title: For Pete's Sake
description: Pete and Gladys Porter move into their new home in Westwood, CA. Things get off to a rocky start when Pete clashes with his new neighbor. This pilot episode uses a different theme song than the rest of the series.

title: Pete's Changing Personality
description: Pete's sales are down, so his boss suggests a session with a beautiful psychologist to improve his grumpy image. Whitney Blake guest stars.

title: Gladys and the Piggy Bank
description: Faced with the decision of how much to spend for their friends' anniversary present, Pete and Gladys solve the problem in a most unorthodox way.

title: No Man Is Japan
description: Pete may get a job transfer to Tokyo, so he arranges for an exchange student from Japan to teach he and Gladys about life and customs there.

title: Misplaced Weekend
description: Pete's boss wants him to work on the weekend Gladys had planned for a getaway. When he lies to get the time off, complications set in when his boss arrives at the same hotel Pete and Gladys are staying at.

title: Cousin Violet
description: Plump Cousin Violet has sent Gladys' picture to her pen pal boyfriend. Now he plants to visit with Violet in person. What will Gladys do?

title: The Six Musketeers
description: Pete and Gladys and two other couples, who happen to be their best friends, rent a cabin in the woods. According to all, it will be a vacation made in heaven because they are all open and honest with each other. Will it? the story unfolds with some added bonuses and the men showing the way.

title: Secretary for a Day
description: Gladys causes chaos at the office when she goes to fill in for Pete, who wants to play golf. Ernest Truex appears as Pop.

title: Peaceful in the Country
description: Pete and Gladys go to stay at his boss' country cabin, accompanied by a huge dog named Strongboy.

title: Gladys Goes to College
description: Gladys goes to college to learn Spanish, but her limited skills are put to the test when she and Pete go to Tiajuana for lunch. Nan Leslie appears as Josie.

title: The Hoarder and the Boarder
description: Gladys can't quite bring herself to part with the items in the garage that Pete insists she dispose of, so she hides them in an unused room in the house.

title: Money, Money, Who's Got the Money?
Uncle Paul's Insurance
description: Pete is afraid to ask Uncle Paul (Gale Gordon) to buy insurance from him, so Bruce tries to hypnotize him into finding out why.

title: Three Loves of Gladys
description: Bruce is blackballed from the fraternity he wishes to join, so Gladys sets out to find the reason why.

title: Sick, Sick, Sick
description: Gladys goes on a TV giveaway program and tells a lie to win the prize.

title: Lover Go Away
description: The Porter's new teenage gardener develops a crush on Gladys.

title: Hero in the House
description: Tonight Pete and Gladys are at the theater but things go awry when a fellow starts abusing Gladys. Brave but not reckless, Pete decides the man is too big to fight with.

title: Who Was That Man?
description: Gladys meets up with an old boyfriend and lies about it to jealous Pete.

title: Garden Wedding
description: Pete and Gladys find they are not legally married. Gladys sees this as the perfect opportunity for a big garden wedding.

title: Follow That Skeleton
description: Uncle Paul has been feuding with his business partner. Gladys jumps to a conclusion when she spots a skeleton in the trunk of his car.

title: Will the Real Michele Tabour Please Stand Up?
description: Gladys is the exact double for a visiting French dancing star.

title: The Case of the Gossipy Maid
